title: Digital Agreement Readiness: Are you still using carrier pigeons in your agreement processes?

questions.question: Are you currently using a forms automation solution at your organization to digitize internal and/or customer-facing agreements? Please select one response.

takeaway.text: As financial institutions (FIs) seek to further their technology investments by digitizing processes that directly impact the customer experience, the business case for agreement automation software is clear.
The first step is to utilize a document generation system that:

bulletPoints: Collects customer information through intelligent, interview-style digital forms;
Facilitates real-time signatures by digitizing the agreement workflow.

questions.question: In which channels have you automated the delivery and execution of digital agreements? Please select all that apply.

takeaway.text: Regardless of where your organization is in its digital agreement journey, enabling this capability across key customer touchpoints will amplify the return from your investment. Leverage your success in one channel as a case study for automating and digitizing your internal and customer-facing agreements across the entire enterprise. Enhancing these digital experiences across channels enables enterprises to be more efficient and effective.

questions.question: Are you currently using eSignatures in your agreement processes? Please select one response.

takeaway.text: Electronic signatures are an essential part of an enterprise digitization strategy. Among financial institutions (FIs) of all sizes, there is tremendous interest in removing paper from business processes and accelerating the digital transformation of the business. The COVID-19 pandemic has only further increased this interest in, and need for, electronic signature solutions. FIs adopting these solutions can offer more convenient and efficient digital experiences for both internal staff, customers and partners.

questions.question: How likely are you to switch eSignature vendors in the next 12 months? Please select one response.

takeaway.text: eSignatures help organizations remain competitive and keep business moving in today’s remote environment. As you assess your current and future eSignature needs, you should ask questions like

bulletPoints: Are there overlapping and redundant solutions in use across my organization?
Are we paying above-market rates for our eSignature solution?
Does our current solution meet our eSignature adoption targets?
Can our current implementation scale for the future growth of our business (i.e., across channels and geographies)?

takeaway.text: A secure, reliable eSignature solution is key to success in the new normal.

questions.question: Which methods are being used by your organization to verify a user's identity before they access and sign digital agreements? Please select all that apply.

takeaway.text: FIs need to pay special attention to the pro-biometrics sentiment now established among consumers. In response, they are increasingly modernizing their authentication systems by using biometric identification and, in particular, liveness detection and behavioral biometrics to reduce fraud and improve the user experience. Machine learning also enables risk assessment in real-time and triggers actions in order to stop fraud; all while increasing the level of your understanding of that user, to build trust and develop more accurate risk scoring. This also allows you to only interrupt the user when absolutely necessary, or when that person might expect or appreciate a visible signal of security (such as a biometric authentication prompt for a higher-risk transaction).

answers.option: ID document verification (e.g., driver's license, passport, etc.)
We don’t ask users to authenticate before they access and sign digital agreements

questions.question: How effective is your organization's digital agreement process at improving completion rates and reducing abandonment? Please select one response.

takeaway.text: It’s important to keep in mind that the more hoops an applicant or customer has to jump through when completing a transaction, the more likely they are to get frustrated and walk away. Each stage of the process that requires a manual or inconvenient task (such as printing documents, scanning, or presenting identity documents in-person), is a point of friction that contributes to a poor experience. Poor customer experiences lead to high abandonment rates as applicants look elsewhere.

questions.question: How effective is your organization's digital agreement process at ensuring compliance and non-repudiation? Please select one response.

takeaway.text: Repudiation and compliance risks are challenging enough to address when executing transactions on paper. If not done properly in the electronic world, these risks can be even greater. The risk of repudiation can be mitigated in your agreement process by ensuring that a person’s eSignature is permanently bound to the exact contents of the record at the time of signing. In addition, the process should mitigate compliance risk by enforcing regulatory requirements and proving that compliant processes are followed throughout a transaction. Digital audit trails can include evidence of compliance, a customer’s identity, or intent. If stored in a tamper-evident package, the evidence can help prove that the resulting agreement is legal, compliant, and enforceable if challenged.
takeaway.moreText: A well-designed process should embed specific controls to maintain compliance and non-repudiation throughout the process﹘it shouldn’t require a CX/security trade off.
